Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (surface partly lost); single added white band near bottom of sherd; exterior: from top, traces of two brown bands; below, painted decoration consisting of goat to left (part of head, neck and shoulder remaining); part of pendant lozenge and elaborate cross as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For the goat, compare Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.82.1894 and GR.58.1894.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0157) (phase 2)
